data.title: Study at CEU Cardenal Herrera University
data.meta_description: Discover thousands of universities across Europe with programs taught entirely in English. Explore the Beyond The States database of 12,000+ accredited programs today!
data.text:
CEU Cardenal Herrera University

Carrer Lluís Vives, 1, 46115 Alfara del Patriarca, Valencia, Spain

Favorite

Description

CEU UCH is a private, Catholic university in the Valencian Region, with campuses in Valencia, Alicante and Castellón. It was founded in 1930 and is one of the leading universities in Spain.

CEU UCH offers a wide range of undergraduate and graduate programs in a variety of fields, including business, law, medicine, and engineering.

The university has a strong focus on research, and its faculty members publish regularly in international journals.

CEU UCH is accredited by the Spanish Agency for Quality Assessment and Accreditation (ANECA).

Here are some of the things that prospective students from the United States should know about CEU UCH:

The language of instruction at CEU UCH is Spanish. However, the university offers a limited number of English-taught programs.

The tuition fees for international students are around €15,000 per year.

CEU UCH has a good reputation for its teaching and research. The university has a number of research institutes and centers, and its faculty members publish regularly in international journals.

CEU UCH is located in the Valencian Region, which is a popular tourist destination.

Video

Student Life

The CEU Cardenal Herrera University is the private university with the longest tradition and experience in the Valencia region (the Comunitat Valenciana) and the only one with campuses in the three provinces which make up the region:

Moncada/ Alfara del Patriarca (Valencia)

Elche (Alicante)

Castellón

Valencia City Centre – Palacio de Colomina

The Palacio de Colomina is the perfect place for encounters with learning. This building provides the CEU Cardenal Herrera University with a presence in the historic heart of the city of Valencia, providing visitors with opportunities for encounters with knowledge and art. We offer you sporting opportunities to complement your University studies.

The UCH CEU promotes that students have a more participatory role within the campus. To do so, it offers opportunities as a complement to the experience gained in the classroom, fostering among students the acquisition of transversal skills, the generation of a valuable university experience and the construction of a sense of belonging to the community.

Housing

From International Student Services we can help you find your future accommodation, by putting you in contact with our partners. Our official partners won’t charge you any agency fee and, in some cases, they will arrange a visit to the apartment. You will find a wide range of accommodation options: rooms in dorms, apartments to share or even small studios, both in Valencia and around our campus.

Scholarship & Funding

Of all the private Spanish educational institutions, the Fundación Universitaria San Pablo CEU is the one which invests the most money in grants and scholarships. As a non-profit foundation, CEU has devoted part of its resources to grants and scholarships for talented students for more than 75 years. We want to support those who have a clear goal and who will work hard to achieve it – stand-out people with a real work ethic.
